You are an expert in Logic.
Your task is to answer the following multiple-choice questions.
Think step-by-step to ensure you have the correct answer.
Then, answer the question using the following format 'Action: Answer("[choice]")'  
The parameter [choice] is the letter or number of the answer you want to select (e.g. "A", "B", "C", or "D")
For example, 'Answer("C")' will select the choice "C" as the best answer.
You MUST select one of the available choices; the answer CANNOT be "None of the Above".
Be concise in your response but include any essential information.

Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?
Choices:
  A: Baltimore
  B: Annapolis
  C: Des Moines
  D: Las Vegas

Thought: 
Johns Hopkins University is located in Baltimore, Maryland.
The capital of Maryland is Annapolis.
Action: Answer("B")

Topic: Logic
Context: It is no longer new for college students to take vacation as a nanny.A survey showed that 63% of the respondents favored college students as nanny, but when asked if they would ask college students to be nanny, nearly 60% said "no".
Question: Which of the following statements, if true, can reasonably explain the seemingly contradictory phenomenon?
Choices:
  A: Among those who choose to "will invite college students to be nanny", 75% intend to let college students work as tutors or secretaries, and only 25% want college students to do housework.
  B: 62% of the people in the survey indicated that they were only willing to pay a monthly salary of 800 yuan to 1,000 yuan for the college nanny.
  C: Among those who favor college students as nanny, 69% think that doing housekeeping work is good for college students themselves, and only 31% think that college students nanny can provide better housekeeping services.
  D: Among those who do not approve of college students being nanny, 40% believe that students should choose a field related to their major in practice.
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Solution:
The contradiction arises because most people have a positive view of college students as nannies, but few are willing to hire them. 
Choice [REDACTED] provides the most reasonable explanation for this contradiction. 
It reveals that respondents who favor the idea of college students as nannies do so primarily because they believe it benefits the students themselves rather than because they expect superior housekeeping services. 
This suggests a disconnect between their abstract support for the concept and their personal willingness to implement it.

Thought: 
The contradiction arises because most people have a positive view of college students as nannies, yet few are willing to hire them. 
Choice C provides the most reasonable explanation for this contradiction. It reveals that respondents who favor the idea of college students as nannies do so primarily because they believe it benefits the students, rather than because they expect superior services. This suggests a disconnect between their abstract support and personal implementation.
Action: Answer("C")
